definition: letter puzzle
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
riddle
see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle
crossword

sentences.english: 1a Read the clues and complete the crossword.
sentences.chinese: 根据所给的线索，完成纵横字谜。

sentences.english: It’s only a crossword puzzle that helps increase my vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 这只是可以帮助我提高单词量的一种纵横字谜。

sentences.english: I've finished the crossword apart from 3 across and 10 down.
sentences.chinese: 这份纵横字谜除横3竖10以外我都填完了。

sentences.english: B. Sarah likes doing word puzzles.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢猜字谜和远足吗？
我一直很喜欢玩字谜游戏。

sentences.english: Various bugs fixed, including display problems and anagram generation.
sentences.chinese: 各种修复的错误，包括显示问题和字谜一代。

sentences.english: Tell jokes to each other, we play games, set off firecrackers and charade, etc.
sentences.chinese: 我们互相讲笑话，玩游戏，放鞭炮，猜字谜等。

sentences.english: It is like a hundred of the same jack puzzle "p".
sentences.chinese: 就会成为字谜中的成百个空格。

sentences.english: My son is clearly no witch at the riddle.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子显然很会猜字谜。

sentences.english: As in a puzzle concocted for children.
sentences.chinese: 就象给孩子制作的字谜游戏。

sentences.english: Does he like doing word puzzles?
It is like one piece of jack puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 就像字谜中的一个空格。

sentences.english: Remember the episode where they all played charades together?
sentences.chinese: 还记得有一集中她们一起猜字谜的场景吗？

sentences.english: This month, we're doing crossword puzzles.
sentences.chinese: 这个月我们要玩字谜游戏。

sentences.english: It's a tradition to solve the puzzles on the lanterns during the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节猜灯笼上的字谜是一个传统。

definition: riddle/conundrum/CL:條|条[tiao2]
riddles written on lanterns (e.g. for the Lantern Festival at the end of Chinese New Year)
to supply the answering phrase
game where the last word of one idiom 成語|成语[cheng2 yu3] is the first of the next
saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
fortune telling by unpicking Chinese characters
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
poetic form consisting of four lines of five syllables, with rhymes on first, second and fourth line
Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
name of "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 訁|讠[yan2]
to fill a job vacancy/to fill in a blank (e.g. on questionnaire or exam paper)
braille
to combine words/word formation
a Chinese character formed by combining existing elements - i.e. a combined ideogram 會意|会意 or radical plus phonetic 形聲|形声
secret language/codeword
idiom
